Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I said when I think about you, I get wet.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: God damn you -- what is happening? Is there no man who'll have me?  This is the weirdest season I ever saw -- the Durham Bulls can't lose and I can't get laid!

Speaker: crash
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I need a drink.

Speaker: crash
Dialogue: Why baseball?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I was raised in a Baptist church got dipped in the water when I was 5 -- born again before kindergarten... by the time I was 10 I knew it was bullshit and at 15 I ran away from home...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: pregnant, had an abortion, got pregnant again, had an abortion again... gave up men. Tried women. Missed men. My mother died.  And after we'd sung some hymns in some wretched Florida funeral home, I went outside and something happened --

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: The smell of cut grass in the warm March air overwhelmed me and I heard a noise --  -- tok, tok, tok -- and some men shouting... then tok, tok, tok.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I crossed the street -- it was the New York Yankees spring training field -- tok, tok, tok, was the sound of a ball hitting a bat -- and I sat in the warm bleachers to think about my mother...  And I saw him.

Speaker: crash
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Thurman Munson.  So I stayed in the bleachers all spring and gradually came to understand what's so great about baseball.

Speaker: crash
Dialogue: What's so great about baseball?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: If you know where home plate is, then you know where 1st base is, and 2nd, and everything else -- 'cause they're always in the same place in relation to home.  Don't you see? If you know where home plate is, then you know where everything else in the universe is!

Speaker: crash
Dialogue: I don't know if I'd go that far.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: It's true, It's true!  Least it used to be true. It ain't possible that baseball's not enough anymore, is it, Crash?

Speaker: crash
Dialogue: It's possible.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: crash
Dialogue: Are you gonna be waking up next to 20 year old ballplayers when you're 60?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Well... I used to think that wasn't the worst thing in the world to look forward to. Lately I'm not so sure.

Dialogue: Omigawd, honey, I'm so happy for you.

Dialogue: He's a virgin.
